SENT.plain: The Catastrophic Anti-phospholipid Syndrome (CAPS) is a rare acute clinical syndrome associated with serum anti-phospholipid antibodies (aPL)
It is rarely preceded by a precipitating event
It may occur as a primary event or be associated with auto-immune diseases

We report a fatal case occurring post-endoscopic retrograde cholangio-pancreatography (ERCP) in a patient with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE), positive lupus anticoagulant and negative IgG with positive IgM anti-cardiolipin titres
The diagnostic and therapeutic difficulties of such cases is addressed
